Soulful & Joyful Art

About me

Hi there! Glad you made it to this site where you can discover my artworks, get to know me a bit better and maybe purchase a piece of art you fell in love with.

I was born and raised in a small town nestled in the mountains in the east of Germany. The art that surrounded me back then was nature. Our wild garden with all kinds of flowers, fruit trees and plants as well as numerous cats and other animals was its own magical ecosystem.

As a teenager I felt I didnâ€™t quite fit in and my biggest dream was to travel and live abroad. I couldnâ€™t wait to finish school to start the adventure I felt was waiting for me.

In the years that followed I lived in France, Great Britain and Belgium and discovered many other places around the world that I only ever knew from movies and books. I followed my passion for languages and studied French and English literature and linguistics and then did a masterâ€™s degree in translation in Leipzig.

Wanderlust never ceased and after university I wanted to make my dream of living abroad for good come true. I am more than grateful that my journey brought me to quirky and international Brussels which I call home for now.

Here I can hear and speak several languages every day, Iâ€™ve found dear friends and colleagues and a place to explore my creativity. Even if the expat magic and challenges have become my daily life, I still think about how amazing it is to make your dreams come true.

Painting has been more of a recent and just as powerful dream. Although I always loved working with my hands and creating things, I wasnâ€™t making as much art as I was busy building my new life.

I started to take classes, learn and teach myself about painting and drawing while I was at university. Once I rediscovered my love for making art, it soon felt like adding a new and deeper dimension to myself. Since then Iâ€™ve been exploring the world of colors, textures, shapes and marks with all my heart and passion.

I started to take classes, learn and teach myself about painting and drawing while I was at university. Once I rediscovered my love for making art, it soon felt like adding a new and deeper dimension to myself. Since then Iâ€™ve been exploring the world of colors, textures, shapes and marks with all my heart and passion.

I am developing my art in different directions, reaching from abstraction to figuration, but always in bold brush strokes and colors. I love the intuitive experience of putting paint on paper or canvas without focusing too much on the outcome. Usually I wonâ€™t have a concrete plan, just try to see where an inspiration â€“ like a color, feeling or song â€“ takes me.

I am in control, yet not controlling.

I enjoy the process of painting just as I enjoy the process of my life. Being excited to start fresh and try new things, being aware that the feeling of being stuck and feeling down is an opportunity for growth, working hard, but also have fun and play. Cherishing the joy of completing a piece and see where the process took me.

Trying to value each moment of every step of the way.
